result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason E. Collier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 22CF449, 21CF227 and to any sentence currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two.
Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 22CF449, 21CF227 and to any sentence currently serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason E. Collier

records.addlTxt:
3:40 PM 
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck and ADA Alexander Lech; Defendant appears in custody from Dodge Correctional Institution via Zoom; Attorney Shari Post appears in person.

Date and time set for a Plea Hearing on 22CF413 and 22CF449 and Sentencing Hearing on Revocation for 21CF227. VRCW.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

Waiver of Prelim on 22CF449
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J. 

State moves to: 
22CF413
COUNT 2: Carrying a Concealed Weapon >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF413
COUNT 1: Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine (<=3g), Second Subsequent Offense >> NO CONTEST.
22CF449
COUNT 1: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

On 22CF413 (Count 1) and 22CF449 (Count 1): COURT ORDERS: 5 years Wisconsin Prison System (2 years IC; 3 years ES); CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; Restitution (none requested); Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances; No possession of alcohol or controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; Maintain FTW/School; CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. 96 days jail credit. Eligible for programming.

Sentencing on Revocation for 21CF227:
COURT ORDERS: 5 years Wisconsin Prison System (2 years IC; 3 years ES); CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; Restitution (none requested); Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances; No possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed and to be only taken as prescribed; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two; CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. 135 days credit. Eligible for programming.

All sentences to run concurrent to each other and the one currently serving. 

Adj: 4:17p.m.
Plea hearing on July 26, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2022 at 09:55 am.
Preliminary Hearing on July 26, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 29, 2022 at 10:50 am.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.     No possession or use of dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (3) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Nikki. 
Case Called: 3:01pm.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears via Zoom, in custody, and with Atty Chad Shamali.
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions defendant re: complaint and rights.
Prelim Time Limits Waived.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY.
Deft on PO hold.

BOND:
$1000.00 cash.

CONDITIONS:
-Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.
-No possession or use of dangerous weapons.
-Prints and photograph.
-Report to ATTIC Correctional Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

DATES:
PTC w/JA: 7/14 @9:55am.
PH: 7/26 @3:20pm. 
JPTC: 8/29 @10:50am. 

Adjourned: 3:05pm.
